page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: At the present time there are few people out of work in the village. Most women work either full or part time, helping in a family business or as a teacher or part-time office staff. Very few women are full-time housewives, in fact 90% of women with children of playgroup age supplement the family income. Several men are self-employed others represent companies around the UK. Most men work in the surrounding towns of Worcester, Birmingham and Redditch and the Midlands, consequently most travel some distance to their work. In fact 98% of people interviewed travelled more than 5 miles. About 4% of the population work on the land because this is a rural area. There are no big factories or major employers in the immediate area so few people work at the same location.
